mountify_mounts.description:
Module mounting config.
0 - disable
1 - manual mode (mount modules that found on modules.txt)
2 - auto mode (mount all modules with system folder)

test_decoy_mount.description:
testing of decoy mounting
This is only meant for tmpfs mode.
0 - disable
1 - enable

mountify_stop_start.description:
Start at service, certain modules might need this.
0 - disable
1 - enable

MOUNT_DEVICE_NAME.description:
You can put 'KSU', 'APatch' here so a umount provider can umount.
e.g. NeoZygisk, NoHello, ReZygisk, Shamiko, Zygisk Assistant, ZygiskNext-DE

mountify_expert_mode.description:
üö® WARNING!
 ‚ö†Ô∏è This disables mountify's safety checks. mostly for debugging purposes.
0 - disable
1 - enable

use_ext4_sparse.description:
ext4 sparse mode override.
This only makes sense if you have tmpfs xattr but you still prefer using an ext4 sparse image to mount.
0 - disable
1 - enable

spoof_sparse.description:
This tries to spoof your sparse mount as some apex service whatever.
This makes sense if you unmount your overlays, so this should go well with a custom MOUNT_DEVICE_NAME.

FAKE_APEX_NAME.description:
Just put random bullshit on this like com.android.wtf
While futile, this tries to make it look legit.

sparse_size.description:
This is for users who wants a custom sparse size.
This does NOT really matter, but it seems important to some.
modify this to any unsigned number.
basically, sparse size in MB.

enable_lkm_nuke.description:
üö® WARNING!
‚ö†Ô∏è Experimental feature.
Loads a oneshot LKM that unregisters ext4 sysfs nodes. 
0 - disable
1 - enable

lkm_filename.description:
Only GKI 5.10+ are properly supported.
Select your Android KMI.
